cons: Difficulty with flexibility in scheduling. Required weekend work (food side), some confusion in scheduling and availability. Not much classroom training after initial orientation. Long hours. Hard work. Low compensation to start. (All on food side)

pros: The Program allows you to live with and mentor fellow students in your chosen field of study. Most people were easy to work with.
cons: Working in the program required you to continue living on campus, so sometimes the bosses would come check on you.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Richmond, VA
pros: The environment is intellectually stimulating and generally laid back for most of the year. The only stressful periods are when grading work clashes with your own work as a student, which tends to be near the end of the semester.
cons: You could be stuck with a large, introductory class, which leads to a comparatively unequal amount of work compared to others who get to teach smaller courses.

pros: I work in the NCRO offices in Northern Virginia and my co-workers are really, really great. They make you feel very appreciated and everyone respects one another. I haven't really been here long enough to comment on career opportunities and since I'm only part-time I have a limited perspective but I truly love coming to work and feel very secure here.
cons: No cons or complaints so far!

review_title: Welcoming place, striving to reach high quality
job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Blacksburg, VA
pros:
- Diversity 
- Quality
- Respect
- Rules applies strictly
cons:
- Supervisors shape your working experience, select yours carefully.

pros: Benefits are amazing, that's about it.
cons: Management seems to hire/promote/give raises based on personal biases. Some departments are (much) better to work in than others. There is definitely special treatment toward some employees and the opposite toward others.

pros: Excellent leadership opportunity for a college student. Highly reccommended for any VT student seeking job that will enhance leadership characteristics
cons: There were very long hours and little sleep time.  Late night and early mornings. The food is medicore for a summer camp.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Blacksburg, VA
pros:

- Low-income

job_title: Student Consultant At 4Help in Blacksburg, VA

cons: None really, maybe the medium pay, but we are students so I can't expect much. I just expect more for working in the IT division, but it still sames to be the same pay as all other university jobs.

job_title: Usher, Cashier, Box Office Associate in Blacksburg, VA

cons: - The only con is that you can't get that many hours due to how little shifts there are and how many people also want hours, but that comes with any part time position.

review_title: Great Place with Lots of Opportunity
pros:
Variable Hours
Great work environment
Room for promotion
Interest in growing the employees
cons: Lots of work politics that can get in the way of people. More about who can complain the most to get someone promoted rather than who is the most qualified.

review_title: Brief Conclusion of my first year at Tech
pros: The campus is so nice and I absolutely love its dining halls. They offer many resources for students to use, but you have to figure it out by yourself. The Smith Career and Newman Library are my favorite places to go for sure.
cons: They have to finish certain courses in order for undergrad students to participate in undergraduate research programs.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Blacksburg, VA
pros: meet lots of people. Lot of opportunities for things to do such as athletics, sports. blacksburg is nice place to live.
cons: not much to do in blacksburg. parking is a pain. tuitition is very high. the weather can be very cold.

review_title: Overall positive experience teaching at this institution

cons: The teaching load can be quite intensive when trying to complete academic requirements, and it is very difficult to take advantage of the certificate programs the university encourages with the required work loa.d

job_title: Junior Systems Administrator in Arlington, VA
pros: You are exposed to alot of different technology, that you get the chance to be hands on with and test out as you feel necessary

job_title: Student Assistant Manager in Blacksburg, VA
pros: Working in campus as a student is very convenient. Shift times and hours are very convenient and made to fit to your schedule.

pros:

- Costs for living in Blacksburg, VA is lower than most other areas in Virginia (I guess)

review_title: Great working environment in a major research university.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Blacksburg, VA

pros: Easy summer job. Paid decently. Good work environment. Flexible schedules are offered. Working environment relaxed and staff is easy going
cons: The downsides involved monotonous type of work. As the calls back to back would get very boring and tiresome indeed.

Free meal pass.

Very easy to learn and run different shops.
Free drinks during break.

Must work weekends.
Not allowed to take home food.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Blacksburg, VA

Able to make a difference in helping students
Flexible hours

review_title: It's good place to upgrade your education level with reasonable living cost.

pros: Great retirement and health care benefits! Managers are always willing to help you success and get to the next step.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Blacksburg, VA
